results.definition: have or contain a certain wording or form
obtain data from magnetic tapes or other digital sources
examples: This dictionary can be read by the computer

results.definition: indicate a certain reading; of gauges and instruments
interpret something in a certain way; convey a particular meaning or impression
examples: I read this address as a satire

results.definition: be a student of a certain subject
examples: She is reading for the bar exam

results.definition: audition for a stage role by reading parts of a role
interpret something that is written or printed
interpret the significance of, as of palms, tea leaves, intestines, the sky; also of human behavior
examples: She read the sky and predicted rain
I can't read his strange behavior
The fortune teller read his fate in the crystal ball

results.definition: look at, interpret, and say out loud something that is written or printed
examples: The King will read the proclamation at noon
the article was a very good read
I read you loud and clear!
